TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
Two more pages. The next witness will be the last.

![rXMWzwQ.png](http://i.imgur.com/rXMWzwQ.png)

![ZJK1VxH.png](http://i.imgur.com/ZJK1VxH.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-08T21:55:40Z" title="11/08/2015 09:55  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 8, 2015</time> by Kuzzter**

oh my...

Not Val...

Kuzzter...

I bet ALL of the crew is on Mort's "law" hit-list

> 
> If she's guilty, Bob, I *have* to...and so do *you*.

Dun Dun DUNN!

Dammit, Mort is right. And Bob is definitely going to do his duty.

I hope Val and Deeman both have something good up their sleeves.

Happy landings!
Boycott Kerbfleet for this atrocious business practice. Leaving employees in an area not kOSHA specified? That's a hefty charge for the CEO, Mort!
Woah, dang. That's a lot of suspense.

I think it's been made abundantly clear that while Mort may legally be in the right, a victory on his part means nothing less than the (entirely legal) end of the whole kerbaled spaceflight program.

Which is against the self-interest of... pretty much everyone in Kerbfleet.
So... either Kuzzter's gonna lay another plot twist on us, or there's going tob e an alternative means of accessing SPAAAAACE for the Lads. Hrm.
I wonder if Bill is going to do a 'I sense a disturbance in the force' type thing with the 1.0.5 update? heh

So Mort's putting Val on the witness stand to proof she's part of a conspirazy that basically everyone except himself, Bob and Tedus could also be, and probably is, involved in? Oh, I've got a bad feeling about this... (happily continuing with the Star Wars references smjjames just started) ...
Love the page, Kuzz! But I will point something out, on the second panel, Dilsby is spelt 'Dislby' might wanna fix that.

> 
> So Mort's putting Val on the witness stand to proof she's part of a conspirazy that basically everyone except himself, Bob and Tedus could also be, and probably is, involved in? Oh, I've got a bad feeling about this... (happily continuing with the Star Wars references smjjames just started) ...

What you said is not a Star Wars reference.

Anyway, I was referring to this: [http://imgur.com/a/QGZZN#8](http://imgur.com/a/QGZZN#8) Which also happens to be a Star Wars reference, or sortof one.

> 
> oh my...
> Not Val...
> 
> Kuzzter...
> 
> I bet ALL of the crew is on Mort's "law" hit-list

Yep, probes ALWAYS do what you tell them...

> 
> I hope Val and Deeman both have something good up their sleeves.

Although I have written some decent dialogue for probes in the past, I hope so too.

> 
> Boycott Kerbfleet for this atrocious business practice. Leaving employees in an area not kOSHA specified? That's a hefty charge for the CEO, Mort!

From tvtropes ["No OSHA Compliance"](http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoOSHACompliance): "The [*Star Wars*](http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/StarWars) galaxy is filled with indoor, 500+ foot deep (and often completely pointless) chasms that have no guard rails."

> 
> Woah, dang. That's a lot of suspense.

Dun dunnnnnn! I hope to get it wrapped up soon--stay tuned!

> 
> I think it's been made abundantly clear that while Mort may legally be in the right, a victory on his part means nothing less than the (entirely legal) end of the whole kerbaled spaceflight program.

Couple of nuances to it, but yeah this could be the end of Kerbfleet as we know it.

> 
> So... either Kuzzter's gonna lay another plot twist on us, or there's going tob e an alternative means of accessing SPAAAAACE for the Lads. Hrm.

Me? Plot twist? Noooooo....

> 
> I wonder if Bill is going to do a 'I sense a disturbance in the force' type thing with the 1.0.5 update? heh

Depends where we are when it happens. I think everyone's going to be home safe before I install, so it might happen between chapters. Bill will probably notice the inevitable hotfix.

> 
> So Mort's putting Val on the witness stand to proof she's part of a conspirazy that basically everyone except himself, Bob and Tedus could also be, and probably is, involved in? Oh, I've got a bad feeling about this... (happily continuing with the Star Wars references smjjames just started) ...

Yep--he can see that Deeman is scoring points with the whole 'code purple' thing, so here's his play for the win. I hope to have it up later tonight! VERY excited to do this next scene.

Nope, I haven't downloaded 1.0.5 yet-- because first I needed to post *THIS!*

I can see the sky behind Mort. Is this an open-air courthouse?
You can't handle the truth, Mort ! ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Val is always such a badS!

Wonderful scene, Kuzzter. I was also sure that would be Deeman's line. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I hope you're checking out 1.0.5 right now.

Happy landings!
Val had this planned, I'm assuming.

> 
> I can see the sky behind Mort. Is this an open-air courthouse?

Naturally. In Kerbfleet, nothing is hidden from view.

> 
> Naturally. In Kerbfleet, nothing is hidden from view.

"Government transparancy"

> 
> "Government transparancy"

"Public Trial" "Habeus Corpus" "Ipso facto"

Whoah-hoho what's with Val's pupils? 0.o

I am now up to date. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> I can see the sky behind Mort. Is this an open-air courthouse?

It's... er... a transparisteel skylight. When this is over I'll share the 'set' to the exchange, I wouldn't want to ruin the magic for anyone

> 
> Whoah-hoho what's with Val's pupils? 0.o

Yes, exactly o.0! I had her do an animation to get up out of her chair for dramatic effect, and the pupils just went like that. Maybe they're blazing with valor? 

> 
> I hope you're checking out 1.0.5 right now.

And just in time! Now that Val's testimony has effectively destroyed Kerbfleet, I'm free to start a fresh career save! Yay! \*dodges flying boosters\*

\*puts on tinfoil hat\*

I choose to believe that you won't abandon this save *yet*.
